marketNews.title: BEI Announces Index Evaluation Results for LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80
marketNews.content: BEI on Friday (25/7) announced the index evaluation for LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80 with an effective period of August 1-October 31, 2025. In this evaluation, AADI and SCMA entered the LQ45 index, while ESSA and SIDO exited that index. For the IDX30 index, ITMG and JPFA entered, while BBTN and MAPI exited. Meanwhile, AADI, PTRO, and RAJA entered the IDX80 index, while GGRM, GJTL, and NISP exited.

marketNews.title: IEA Forecasts Global Coal Demand Growth and Indonesian Production Decrease for 2025
marketNews.content: International Energy Agency (IEA) estimates that global coal demand will increase slightly by +0.2% YoY during 2025, driven by increased demand from the US (+7% YoY) compensating for the decrease from China (+0.5% YoY) and Europe (-1.6% YoY). Moving forward, IEA projects global coal demand will decrease by -0.2% YoY in 2026 to 8.78 billion tons (vs. 2024 realization: 8.79 billion tons). IEA projects Indonesia will record a production volume decline of -10% YoY during 2025 to 755 million tons.

marketNews.title: Government Extends 100% VAT DTP Incentive for Property Sector for 2H25; Confirms No Electricity Tariff Discount Stimulus
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Friday (25/7) that the government agreed to extend the VAT DTP for the property sector by 100% for 2H25, instead of 50% as previously planned. Airlangga also mentioned that there are a number of other stimulus packages being discussed with ministries/agencies, including discount programs during the Christmas and New Year period such as airplane ticket fares, toll rates, and train fares. Meanwhile, the government confirmed it will not provide electricity tariff discounts in the stimulus package to be distributed in 2H25.

marketNews.title: US and EU Clinch Deal to Avoid Trump Tariff Hike Ahead of Deadline
marketNews.content: The US and the EU on Sunday (27/7) agreed on a trade framework, which will result in EU exports being subject to a 15% tariff by the US, including car products. President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said that this agreement will bring "stability" and "predictability." US President, Donald Trump, said that the EU also agreed to purchase US energy products worth 750 billion US dollars and invest 600 billion US dollars in the US. Bloomberg reported that a 15% tariff will apply to almost all EU exports to the US, including cars. However, this agreement does not cover steel and aluminum exports from the EU, which will remain subject to a 50% tariff by the US.

tickerNews.title: AKRA 1H25: Net Profit +18% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo ($AKRA) recorded a net profit of 615 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+51% YoY, +9% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 1.18 trillion rupiah (+18% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 47% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 3-year average: 41% of annual net profit) and around 45-49% of managementâ€™s 2025 guidance.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: Profit Before Tax from Trade and Distribution Segment +30% YoY in 1H25
tickerNews.content: Profit before tax (PBT) from the 'trade and distribution' segment - which contributed about 70% of total PBT FY24 - recovered, growing +49% YoY during 2Q25. This result caused the PBT from the 'trade and distribution' segment to grow +30% YoY in 1H25, mainly supported by the low-base effect in 1H24 due to RKAB permit issues for customers in the mining segment. Moving forward, AKRA management sees potential weakening of fuel demand volume from mining clients due to weakening mining commodity prices. To address this issue, management will optimize fuel volume sales to existing industrial clients (non-mining) and the retail segment (bp AKR). Management explained that fuel sales volume from the industrial segment stabilized at a high level, after new clients acquired by the company in 1H24 started becoming repeat customers. Regarding the change in RKAB duration from once every 3 years to once every 1 year, AKRA management stated that the company is accustomed to this system. Nevertheless, management is still awaiting official regulations from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources regarding implementation technicalities.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: JIIPE Land Sales Grow +21% YoY in 1H25
tickerNews.content: PBT from the 'industrial estate' segment was recorded at 234 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+114% YoY, +195% QoQ), resulting in a growth of +7% YoY for 1H25. The performance increase in the 'industrial estate' segment was mainly supported by JIIPE land sales and the increase in recurring income from land leases as well as electricity and utility revenue. JIIPE land sales reached 22 ha in 1H25 (+21% YoY), in line with management's explanation in the earnings call in 1Q25. AKRA management explained that several new clients will decide on their land purchase plans in 4Q25, relatively in line with the pattern of the last few years. AKRA management remains optimistic about the target of 80-100 ha of land sales in 2025, driven by backlog contracts from last year up to 1H25.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Plans Interim Dividend of Rp50/Share, Indicating 3.8% Yield
tickerNews.content: AKRA plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to approximately 990 billion rupiah or 50 rupiah per share, equivalent to 84% of 1H25 net profit. This amount indicates a dividend yield of 3.8% as of Monday (28/7). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is August 5, 2025, with payment on August 19, 2025. In the 2024 fiscal year, AKRA also distributed an interim dividend of 50 rupiah per share in August 2024.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Key Takeaway: Performance Exceeding Expectations Supports 2025 Guidance
tickerNews.content: AKRA's performance exceeding expectations in 1H25 makes us remain optimistic that the company can achieve its 2025 guidance. This is based on the consideration: 1) the guidance is already quite conservative compared to the realized net profit in 2024 which was relatively low (-20% YoY), so there is a low-base effect; and 2) AKRA has secured a backlog of land sales contracts that have not yet been realized in 2024.

tickerNews.title: CMRY 1H25: Net Profit +24% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: $CMRY: Cisarua Mountain Dairy recorded a net profit of 514 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+24% YoY, +7% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 994 billion rupiah (+24% YoY), exceeding expectations because it equals 59% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 2-year average: 51% of annual net profit realization). Net profit growth in 2Q25 was mainly driven by: 1) revenue growth (+21% YoY, +11% QoQ) along with growth in the 'consumer foods' segment (+33% YoY, +13% QoQ); and 2) operating profit margin expansion to 23.6% (vs. 2Q24: 19.9%, 1Q25: 20.7%) following the decrease in general and administrative expenses to 39 billion rupiah (-26% YoY, -33% QoQ) and the leveling off of the sales expense to revenue ratio to 20.3% (vs. 2Q24: 22.5%, 1Q25: 21.3%).

tickerNews.title: PTRO: Subsidiary of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) Acquires Shares, Increasing Ownership to 45.313%
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi's ($CUAN) subsidiary and controlling shareholder of Petrosea, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 2.6 million shares of PTRO at an average price of approximately 3,847 rupiah per share on July 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 10 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 45.287% to 45.313%. tickerNews.title: CNMA: Swings to Net Profit of 358 Billion Rupiah in 2Q25, 1H25 Net Profit Down -26% YoY
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sejahtera Raya recorded a net profit of 358 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+45% YoY), turning around from a net loss of 69 billion rupiah in 1Q25. This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 288 billion rupiah (-26% YoY), equivalent to 34% of the 2025F estimate consensus (vs. 1H24: 53% realization for FY24). Net profit growth in 2Q25 was supported by an increase in revenue to 1.9 trillion rupiah (+18% YoY, +110% QoQ) and a decrease in the opex-to-sales ratio to 74% (vs. 2Q24: 70%, 1Q25: 108%). Nevertheless, total revenue during 1H25 decreased by -3% YoY to 2.9 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 45% of the 2025F consensus estimate. Operationally, the number of viewers during 1H25 decreased by -8.6% YoY to 42.5 million and the occupancy rate dropped to 24% (vs. 1H24: 26%), although the average ticket price rose by +4.9% YoY to 46,483 rupiah. In the earnings call on Monday (28/7), CNMA management maintained the guidance for the number of viewers during 2025 in the range of 90-92 million viewers, although indicating that the realization will likely be at the lower end of this guidance.

tickerNews.title: PANI Marketing Sales at 1.2 Trillion Rupiah in 1H25 (-65% YoY), CBDK at 294 Billion Rupiah (-75% YoY)
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI) recorded marketing sales of 699 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-62% YoY, +50% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales in 1H25 to 1.2 trillion rupiah (-65% YoY), equivalent to 22% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, Bangun Kosambi Sukses ($CBDK) recorded marketing sales of 55 billion rupiah during 2Q25 (-78% YoY, -77% QoQ), resulting in marketing sales in 1H25 reaching 294 billion rupiah (-75% YoY) or equivalent to 15% of the 2025 target. PANI management attributed the decline in marketing sales to more cautious consumer attitudes.

tickerNews.title: CDIA Commissioner Andre Khor Kah Hin Increases Direct Ownership Following Second Purchase
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi Commissioner, Andre Khor Kah Hin, purchased 4.25 million CDIA shares at an average price of 1,050 rupiah per share on July 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Andre Khor Kah Hin's direct ownership in CDIA increased from 0.012% to 0.015%. Previously, Andre Khor Kah Hin also purchased 15 million (0.012%) CDIA shares at an average price of 800 rupiah per share on July 17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Subsidiary Increases Stake in Singapore's Hiap Seng Industries to 11.9%, Shares Surge +160%
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific through its subsidiary, Chandra Asri Trading Company Pte. Ltd., purchased a 7.4% stake in Hiap Seng Industries Ltd. (SGX: 1L2), valuing approximately 2.6 million Singapore dollars or approximately 34 billion rupiah, equivalent to 0.008 Singapore dollars per share. After this transaction, Chandra Asri Trading Company Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in Hiap Seng Industries Ltd. increased from 4.5% to 11.9%. Following this announcement, the share price of Hiap Seng Industries Ltd. increased by +160% from 0.015 Singapore dollars on Wednesday (23/7) to 0.039 Singapore dollars on Friday (25/7). Hiap Seng Industries Ltd. itself is a Singaporean company engaged in mechanical engineering, plant fabrication, construction, and maintenance for the energy industry.

tickerNews.title: NRCA Plans to Sell Treasury Shares from Buyback
tickerNews.content: Nusa Raya Cipta ($NRCA) plans to sell or transfer treasury shares resulting from buyback up to approximately 24.8 million shares, with an implementation period from August 1, 2025, until completion. The treasury shares are the result of a buyback in 2020 at an average price of 297.44 rupiah per share. The sale of these treasury shares will be conducted through PT Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia at a price according to the provisions of POJK No. 29/2023. After this transaction is completed, NRCA will no longer hold treasury shares.

tickerNews.title: LPCK 1H25 Marketing Sales Reach 791 Billion Rupiah (+7% YoY), Achieving 48% of 2025 Target
tickerNews.content: Lippo Cikarang ($LPCK) recorded marketing sales of 468 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+13% YoY, +45% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales in 1H25 to 791 billion rupiah (+7% YoY), equivalent to 48% of the 2025 target of 1.65 trillion rupiah. Marketing sales during 1H25 were contributed by the residential segment (52%), commercial (40%), and industrial (8%).

tickerNews.title: STRK Shareholder Sells 15% Stake for 15 Rupiah per Share for Strategic Cooperation, Aiming for Export Markets
tickerNews.content: Lovina Beach Brewery ($STRK) shareholder, PT Barito Mas Sukses, sold 1.6 billion (15%) STRK shares at a price of 15 rupiah per share on July 16, 2025. This transaction is intended for strategic cooperation. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Barito Mas Sukses in STRK decreased to 61.87%. Kontan reported that the shares were sold to Asset Whale Pte. Ltd., a business development and consulting company based in Singapore. STRK President Director, Bona Budhisurya, told Kontan that the partnership marks a momentum for the company in preparing the global launch of its newest product range, including to major markets such as Japan, the US, and China.
